desc: I'm needing someone to update my Android app,The work required involves adding a segmented control bar to the bottom of a window, When option 1 is selected (Standard library) that just displays the already shown table view, When option 2 is selected firstly the user would see a list of options (Register, Sign in, Learn more, Cancel) - Please see attached images.I can supply all the required URLs and even the iOS code that is in use currently.The iOS app uses XML data, however the Android app it would be preferable to request JSON data from the servers so an understanding of JSON would be highly recommended.The app would store the log in details on device so that once a user is logged in they won't need to log in every time. (A log out button would need to be added to the settings view of the app)Once the user is logged in, it simply shows a webview. This is all served from the web server. However the user then can select a product from the webview and there are 2 buttons on that page, 1 will download and store some JSON data to an SQLite database on the device. The 2nd button downloads and stores a PDF manual and then would open it with the PDF reader that is already in use in the app (PlugPDF)I can record a video that shows all of this to better explain.Many thanks,Andrew
title: Update an Android App

desc: Hi there,I'd love for you to become part of the insurance industry’s biggest digital leap in almost 10 years.After recently working within the insurance trade and witnessing the intense pressure the industry faces to catch up and go digital, I decided not to wait around and to capitalize on this enormous opportunity.The idea is to create an interface online where an insurer provides motor claim updates to their client. The client will not have access to the online website, but instead will have an app which they receive their claim updates on, update their own claim details where necessary, and have access to any relevant claim information.From the insurer’s perspective they finally begin their digital path and reduce both their inbound and outbound calls. At the same time they provide their clients a cleaner, happier & more fluid claim experience leading to higher feedback scores.We’d be honored if you were interested in working with us and I look forward to hearing your thoughts.Kind regards,Daniel Austin

desc: Quick and easy NFC programming tool.Requirement = build a tool with 8 Steps:(For tool to function, requires a CSV data file (or other database format/structure) + NFC devices):1. Take a line of the CSV file into 'memory'  including line number & data value2. Generate a random (16 character?) password3. Read a new NTAG213 enabled device4. Capture the tag serial number5. Write the data value (from the CSV file line) to the Tag6. Password protect that field (or is the only option to protect the whole tag) using the random password7. Update the CSV file/create a new output file with the Line number, data value, serial number, password, and date stamp information8. Swipe device again to verify data is correctly written and is readable, with visible confirmation (e.g. Green screen + sound effect for good, or red screen + sound effect for bad)9. Repeat with next line of CSV until it is done.QA steps needed to be integrated to support the above steps in case of read issue, and to make sure that devices do not get locked in a blank state with no known password.The UI is not important as this is a simple personal programming tool.
title: Build an NFC programming tool
